--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...> 
wrote:
> I just started checking out this site and found that they have full 
scans of at least some volumes of Captain Brinkley's 1901 "Oriental 
Series."
> 
>  http://tinyurl.com/w67b
> 
> 
> I've been looking through volume one and the quality of the scans 
is quite good.  Anyone who has been talking about making books 
available on line should check it out for the navigation experience.  
Of course the content is classic, too.  Be aware that every page is 
scanned, even blank ones, so it takes a bit of clicking to get to the 
beginning of the text... about 19 pages in.
> 
> Jim
>


Jim und all,
Once in a while, you can find Cpt. Brinkley's volumes  in e-bay.
I got my set there, different editions but the text/illustrations are 
the same .
It is easier to leaf through the actual books than to click, scroll, 
click, scroll again und again.........
just my personal experience, of course.


Milt
